children.subject:
You should wait until after taking CS61C to determine if you are interested in CS152. 

CS70 + CS188 is fine if you are comfortable with probability. CS70+CS61C is a little more work, since 61C has more intensive projects than 188, but it should be an easier combination

history.content:
Last semester I took 16A, Math 54, and 70 together and I knew a lot of people taking 70 and 61C together who were dying at least once a month. It went badly. I passed 70 with the grade I needed to declare. I noticed early that I wouldn't do well in 16A and I P/NP. And even though I was falling behind in Math 54 I refused to drop it because a professor that I enjoyed was teaching it. I didn't P/NP it and now I have to retake it this coming semester. 

As I look back now, the coursework was definitely manageable had I not been overly stressed about declaring. I heard too many horror stories about getting great grades in 61A/61B and crashing hard in 70. I sunk all my attention into that class. I wish I had dropped 54 or P/NP when I realized I was falling behind. I can't really comment on what it is you're able to handle in a semester, but if you think you can do it, go ahead and try, but keep in mind the drop deadline just in case things get rough. Prioritize 70 as you want to declare. Assess your ability to handle the course load early in the semester so you can make the right choice.

Lastly, I want to make a comparison between what you're doing with 61C and what I did with Math 54 (i.e. taking it because I enjoyed the professor). Unfortunately, we're all madly in love with Dan and it's hard not to jump at the opportunity to take something he's teaching, but if the course becomes too much, don't drag your way through it because of Dan. Drop it and take it with someone else, because if you fail you'll have to do it anyway. And if you pass, but didn't give it your all because of 70 then you may not leave getting everything you wanted from the course. But take my 61C advice with a grain of salt. I haven't taken it yet, plan to next Spring.

children.subject: I'm happy to hear that! Email me anytime (khadijah.flowers@berkeley.edu)

I just want to express my thank to Khadijah, I really appreciate your response!! The experienced you have encountered inspired me a lot. Based on your answer, I believe we share so much in common and I believe we can be friends!  I really appreciate your help...!

history.content:
I 'm a rising sophomore intended CS, I've taken CS61A but it was a really bad semester because of some reasons. I 'm currently taking 61BL and really enjoy it, besides it seems like I am going to have at least an A-. 

  I want to declare the major as soon as possible in order for the upper class in the future. I intended to take CS70 + CS188 together in the fall, but I changed my mind to take 61C since more fundamentals would be better for future class and it's Dan teaching next semester, I really enjoy learning with him through the experience in CS10. Is a CS70+CS61C+EE16A sounds better than 70 + 188 + 16A? Maybe some advice on other class concurrently? 

Apart from that, I would probably take CS170 + EE16B + EE127 in 2019 Spring, maybe some recommendations? 

Besides, it seems like I would take CS152 in the future, I 'm kinda of interested in the description, any advice of it? importance, workload etc?

I'd be really appreciated! Thanks
history.subject: CS70+CS61C+EE16A + any other recommendations ?
